articles.title: Chinese Consul General in Chongjin Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Consul General in Chongjin Hosts Reception 
    Chongjin, October 1 (KCNA) -- Wang Yonggui, Chinese consul general in Chongjin, hosted a reception at the consulate general on Sept. 30 on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of the People's Republic of China.
 Present on invitation were Kim Song Gwon, vice-chairman of the North Hamgyong Provincial People's Committee and chairman of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Korea-China Friendship Association, and other officials concerned.
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Guinean Independence Day Observed
articles.content:
Guinean Independence Day Observed 
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting celebrating the 45th anniversary of the independence of Guinea was held at the Chollima House of Culture on October 1.
 Present there were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is also vice-chairman of the Korea-Guinea Friendship Association, members of the association and working people in the city.    
 A speech was made and a message of greetings to the Guinean president was adopted at the meeting.

Greetings to President of Cyprus
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cyprus
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Tassos Papadopoulos, president of Cyprus, on Sept. 30, on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the president greater success in his responsible work for a peaceful solution to the issue of Cyprus and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to German President
articles.content:
Greetings to German President
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Johannes Rau, president of Germany, on the occasion of its national day.
 In the belief that the relations between the DPRK and Germany would continue to grow stronger in conformity with mutual interests, the message wished him greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.

articles.title: Russian VIPs Arrive
articles.content:
Russian VIPs Arrive
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Sergey Mikhailovich Darkin, governor of the Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation, and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Chairman of the Pyongyang Municipal People's Committee Ryang Man Gil, Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung, officials concerned and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Gennadievich Karlov.

articles.title: DPRK-Russian Talks Held
articles.content:
DPRK-Russian Talks Held
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Talks between Ri Kwang Gun, minister of Foreign Trade of the DPRK, and Sergey Mikhailovich Darkin, governor of the Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation, took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were officials concerned and from the Russian side the party of the governor of the Maritime Territory and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK.    
 At the talks the two sides discussed issues of cooperation in forestry, agriculture, fishery, construction, mining, trade and other fields before reaching consensus of views and decided to concretize the relevant pratical issues.

articles.title: Russian Guests Visit Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Russian Guests Visit Kumsusan Memorial Palace
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Sergey Mikhailovich Darkin, governor of the Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation, and his party today visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung who lies in state.
 They looked round with keen interest orders, medals and certificates of honorary titles the President received in the DPRK and from different countries of the world, the mourning hall, a train car used by him for his on-site guidance and foreign trips and a car he used in the last days of his life.    
 The governor made an entry in the visitor's book.
